href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Score#1970s" title="Academy Award for Best Original Score">Best Original Song Score</a> for the film <i>Let It Be</i> (1970).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200696_305-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200696-305">[296]</a></sup> The recipients of seven Grammy Awards<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-441"><a href="#cite_note-441">[431]</a></sup> and fifteen <a href="/wiki/Ivor_Novello_Awards" title="Ivor Novello Awards">Ivor Novello Awards</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a559–560_442-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a559–560-442">[432]</a></sup> the Beatles have six <a href="/wiki/Music_recording_certification" title="Music recording certification">Diamond albums</a>, as well as 20 Multi-Platinum albums, 16 Platinum albums and six Gold albums in the US.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-RIAAb_316-1"><a href="#cite_note-RIAAb-316">[307]</a></sup> In the UK, the Beatles have four <a href="/wiki/Music_recording_certification" title="Music recording certification">Multi-Platinum albums</a>, four <a href="/wiki/Music_recording_certification" title="Music recording certification">Platinum albums</a>, eight <a href="/wiki/Music_recording_certification" title="Music recording certification">Gold albums</a> and one <a href="/wiki/Music_recording_certification" title="Music recording certification">Silver album</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BPI2009_317-1"><a href="#cite_note-BPI2009-317">[308]</a></sup> They were inducted into the <a href="/wiki/Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Rock and Roll Hall of Fame">Rock and Roll Hall of Fame</a> in 1988.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-R&amp;R_HoF_337-1"><a href="#cite_note-R&amp;R_HoF-337">[327]</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/List_of_best-selling_music_artists" title="List of best-selling music artists">best-selling band</a> in history, the Beatles have sold more than 600 million units as of 2012<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Beatles&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-bbc41012_443-0"><a href="#cite_note-bbc41012-443">[433]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-445"><a href="#cite_note-445">[nb 11]</a></sup> They have had more <a href="/wiki/List_of_artists_by_number_of_UK_Albums_Chart_number_ones" title="List of artists by number of UK Albums Chart number ones">number-one albums on the UK charts</a>, fifteen,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-446"><a href="#cite_note-446">[435]</a></sup> and sold more singles in the UK, 21.9 million, than any other act.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-447"><a href="#cite_note-447">[436]</a></sup> In 2004, <i>Rolling Stone</i> ranked the Beatles as the most significant and influential rock music artists of the last 50 years.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-448"><a href="#cite_note-448">[437]</a></sup> They ranked number one on <i><a href="/wiki/Billboard_(magazine)" title="Billboard (magazine)">Billboard</a></i> magazine's list of the all-time most successful Hot 100 artists, released in 2008 to celebrate the US singles chart's 50th anniversary.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-449"><a href="#cite_note-449">[438]</a></sup> As of 2017<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Beatles&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, they hold the record for most number-one hits on the <i>Billboard</i> Hot 100, with twenty.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-hot100_450-0"><a href="#cite_note-hot100-450">[439]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Recording_Industry_Association_of_America" title="Recording Industry Association of America">Recording Industry Association of America</a> certifies that the Beatles have sold 183 million units in the US, more than any other artist.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-insider_451-0"><a href="#cite_note-insider-451">[440]</a></sup> They were collectively included in <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i> magazine's compilation of the <a href="/wiki/Time_100:_The_Most_Important_People_of_the_Century" title="Time 100: The Most Important People of the Century">20th century's 100 most influential people</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-452"><a href="#cite_note-452">[441]</a></sup> In 2014, they received the <a href="/wiki/Grammy_Lifetime_Achievement_Award" title="Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award">Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-453"><a href="#cite_note-453">[442]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 16 January each year, beginning in 2001, people celebrate World Beatles Day under <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>. This date has direct relation to the opening of <a href="/wiki/The_Cavern_Club" title="The Cavern Club">the Cavern Club</a> in 1957.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-454"><a href="#cite_note-454">[443]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-455"><a href="#cite_note-455">[444]</a></sup> In 2007, the Beatles became the first band to feature on a <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain_commemorative_stamps_2000%E2%80%932009" title="Great Britain commemorative stamps 2000–2009">series of UK postage stamps</a> issued by the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Mail" title="Royal Mail">Royal Mail</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-456"><a href="#cite_note-456">[445]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personnel">Personnel</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/List_of_members_of_bands_featuring_members_of_the_Beatles" title="List of members of bands featuring members of the Beatles">List of members of bands featuring members of the Beatles</a></div>
<div>
<table class="multicol" role="presentation" style="border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0; border: 0; background:transparent; width:100%;">

<td style="width: 50%;text-align: left; vertical-align: top;">
<p><b>Principal members</b>
</p>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a> – vocals, guitars, keyboards, harmonica, bass <small>(1960–1969; died 1980)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a> – vocals, bass, guitars, keyboards, drums <small>(1960–1970)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/George_Harrison" title="George Harrison">George Harrison</a> – guitars, vocals, sitar, keyboards, bass <small>(1960–1970; died 2001)</small></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ringo_Starr" title="Ringo Starr">Ringo Starr</a> – drums, percussion, vocals <small>(1962–1970)</small></li></ul>
</td>

<li><a href="/wiki/Stuart_Sutcliffe" title="Stuart Sutcliffe">Stuart Sutcliffe</a> – bass, vocals <small>(1960–1961; died 1962)</small></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Norman_Chapman" title="Norman Chapman">Norman Chapman</a> – drums <small>(1960; died 1995)</small></li>

</p>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Timeline">Timeline</span></h3>
<div class="timeline-wrapper"><map name="timeline_3n3r93kxx36u1by4jntna81ltl9l00m"></map><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/timeline/3n3r93kxx36u1by4jntna81ltl9l00m.png" usemap="#timeline_3n3r93kxx36u1by4jntna81ltl9l00m"/></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Discography">Discography</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/The_Beatles_discography" title="The Beatles discography">The Beatles discography</a></div>
<p>The Beatles have a core catalogue consisting of 13 studio albums and one compilation.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisohn1988200–201_457-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELewisohn1988200–201-457">[446]</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r998391716">.mw-parser-output .div-col{margin-top:0.3em;column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .div-col-small{font-size:90%}.mw-parser-output .div-col-rules{column-rule:1px solid #aaa}.mw-parser-output .div-col dl,.mw-parser-output .div-col ol,.mw-parser-output .div-col ul{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .div-col li,.mw-parser-output .div-col dd{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}</style><div class="div-col">
<ul><li><i><a href="/wiki/Please_Please_Me" title="Please Please Me">Please Please Me</a></i> (1963)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/With_the_Beatles" title="With the Beatles">With the Beatles</a></i> (1963)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/A_Hard_Day%27s_Night_(album)" title="A Hard Day's Night (album)">A Hard Day's Night</a></i> (1964)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Beatles_for_Sale" title="Beatles for Sale">Beatles for Sale</a></i> (1964)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Help!" title="Help!">Help!</a></i> (1965)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Rubber_Soul" title="Rubber Soul">Rubber Soul</a></i> (1965)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Revolver_(Beatles_album)" title="Revolver (Beatles album)">Revolver</a></i> (1966)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Sgt._Pepper%27s_Lonely_Hearts_Club_Band" title="Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band">Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band</a></i> (1967)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Magical_Mystery_Tour" title="Magical Mystery Tour">Magical Mystery Tour</a></i> (1967)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Beatles_(album)" title="The Beatles (album)">The Beatles</a></i> (1968) ("The White Album")</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Yellow_Submarine_(album)" title="Yellow Submarine (album)">Yellow Submarine</a></i> (1969)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Abbey_Road" title="Abbey Road">Abbey Road</a></i> (1969)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Let_It_Be_(Beatles_album)" title="Let It Be (Beatles album)">Let It Be</a></i> (1970)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Past_Masters" title="Past Masters">Past Masters</a></i> (1988, compilation)</li></ul>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Song_catalogue">Song catalogue</span></h2>
<p>Through 1969, the Beatles' catalogue was published almost exclusively by <a href="/wiki/Northern_Songs" title="Northern Songs">Northern Songs Ltd</a>, a company formed in February 1963 by music publisher <a href="/wiki/Dick_James" title="Dick James">Dick James</a> specifically for Lennon and McCartney, though it later acquired songs by other artists. The company was organised with James and his partner, Emmanuel Silver, owning a controlling interest, variously described as 51% or 50% plus one share. McCartney had 20%. Reports again vary concerning Lennon's portion – 19 or 20% – and Brian Epstein's – 9 or 10% – which he received in lieu of a 25% band management fee.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200615–17_458-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200615–17-458">[447]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTENorman1996169–71,_368–369_459-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTENorman1996169–71,_368–369-459">[448]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBrownGaines2002178_460-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBrownGaines2002178-460">[449]</a></sup> In 1965, the company went public. Five million shares were created, of which the original principals retained 3.75 million. James and Silver each received 937,500 shares (18.75% of 5 million); Lennon and McCartney each received 750,000 shares (15%); and Epstein's management company, NEMS Enterprises, received 375,000 shares (7.5%). Of the 1.25 million shares put up for sale, Harrison and Starr each acquired 40,000.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200637–38_461-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200637–38-461">[450]</a></sup> At the time of the stock offering, Lennon and McCartney renewed their three-year publishing contracts, binding them to Northern Songs until 1973.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200642_462-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200642-462">[451]</a></sup>
</p><p>Harrison created <a href="/wiki/Harrisongs" title="Harrisongs">Harrisongs</a> to represent his Beatles compositions, but signed a three-year contract with Northern Songs that gave it the copyright to his work through March 1968, which included "<a href="/wiki/Taxman" title="Taxman">Taxman</a>" and "<a href="/wiki/Within_You_Without_You" title="Within You Without You">Within You Without You</a>".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200645_463-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200645-463">[452]</a></sup> The songs on which Starr received co-writing credit before 1968, such as "<a href="/wiki/What_Goes_On_(Beatles_song)" title="What Goes On (Beatles song)">What Goes On</a>" and "<a href="/wiki/Flying_(Beatles_instrumental)" title="Flying (Beatles instrumental)">Flying</a>", were also Northern Songs copyrights.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200646–47_464-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200646–47-464">[453]</a></sup> Harrison did not renew his contract with Northern Songs when it ended, signing instead with <a href="/wiki/Apple_Corps" title="Apple Corps">Apple Publishing</a> while retaining the copyright to his work from that point on. Harrison thus owns the rights to his later Beatles songs such as "<a href="/wiki/While_My_Guitar_Gently_Weeps" title="While My Guitar Gently Weeps">While My Guitar Gently Weeps</a>" and "Something". That year, as well, Starr created <a href="/wiki/Startling_Music" title="Startling Music">Startling Music</a>, which holds the rights to his Beatles compositions, "Don't Pass Me By" and "<a href="/wiki/Octopus%27s_Garden" title="Octopus's Garden">Octopus's Garden</a>".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200660–61_465-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200660–61-465">[454]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMacDonald2005351_466-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMacDonald2005351-466">[455]</a></sup>
</p><p>In March 1969, James arranged to sell his and his partner's shares of Northern Songs to the British broadcasting company <a href="/wiki/Associated_Television" title="Associated Television">Associated Television</a> (ATV), founded by impresario <a href="/wiki/Lew_Grade" title="Lew Grade">Lew Grade</a>, without first informing the Beatles. The band then made a bid to gain a controlling interest by attempting to work out a deal with a consortium of London brokerage firms that had accumulated a 14% holding.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTENorman1996369–372_467-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTENorman1996369–372-467">[456]</a></sup> The deal collapsed over the objections of Lennon, who declared, "I'm sick of being fucked about by men in suits sitting on their fat arses in <a href="/wiki/City_of_London" title="City of London">the City</a>."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTENorman1996372_468-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTENorman1996372-468">[457]</a></sup> By the end of May, ATV had acquired a majority stake in Northern Songs, controlling nearly the entire Lennon–McCartney catalogue, as well as any future material until 1973.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMiles1998296_469-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMiles1998296-469">[458]</a></sup> In frustration, Lennon and McCartney sold their shares to ATV in late October 1969.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEEverett1999236_470-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEEverett1999236-470">[459]</a></sup>
</p><p>In 1981, financial losses by ATV's parent company, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Associated_Communications_Corporation" title="Associated Communications Corporation">Associated Communications Corporation</a> (ACC), led it to attempt to sell its music division. According to authors Brian Southall and Rupert Perry, Grade contacted McCartney, offering ATV Music and Northern Songs for $30 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006129_471-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006129-471">[460]</a></sup> According to an account McCartney gave in 1995, he met with Grade and explained he was interested solely in the Northern Songs catalogue if Grade were ever willing to "separate off" that portion of ATV Music. Soon afterwards, Grade offered to sell him Northern Songs for £20 million, giving the ex-Beatle "a week or so" to decide. By McCartney's account, he and Ono countered with a £5 million bid that was rejected.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006130_472-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006130-472">[461]</a></sup> According to reports at the time, Grade refused to separate Northern Songs and turned down an offer of £21–25 million from McCartney and Ono for Northern Songs. In 1982, ACC was acquired in a <a href="/wiki/Takeover" title="Takeover">takeover</a> by Australian business magnate <a href="/wiki/Robert_Holmes_%C3%A0_Court" title="Robert Holmes à Court">Robert Holmes à Court</a> for £60 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006130,_139_473-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006130,_139-473">[462]</a></sup>
</p><p>In 1985, <a href="/wiki/Michael_Jackson" title="Michael Jackson">Michael Jackson</a> purchased ATV for a reported $47.5 million. The acquisition gave him control over the publishing rights to more than 200 Beatles songs, as well as 40,000 other copyrights.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006140,_174,_176_474-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006140,_174,_176-474">[463]</a></sup> In 1995, in a deal that earned him a reported $110 million, Jackson merged his music publishing business with <a href="/wiki/Sony" title="Sony">Sony</a>, creating a new company, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sony/ATV_Music_Publishing" title="Sony/ATV Music Publishing">Sony/ATV Music Publishing</a>, in which he held a 50% stake. The merger made the new company, then valued at over half a billion dollars, the third-largest music publisher in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006198_475-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006198-475">[464]</a></sup> In 2016, Sony acquired Jackson's share of Sony/ATV from the Jackson estate for $750 million.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-476"><a href="#cite_note-476">[465]</a></sup>
</p><p>Despite the lack of publishing rights to most of their songs, Lennon's estate and McCartney continue to receive their respective shares of the writers' royalties, which together are 33<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1020198016" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><span class="frac" role="math"><span class="num">1</span>⁄<span class="den">3</span></span>% of total commercial proceeds in the US and which vary elsewhere around the world between 50 and 55%.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006195_477-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006195-477">[466]</a></sup> Two of Lennon and McCartney's earliest songs – "Love Me Do" and "P.S. I Love You" – were published by an EMI subsidiary, Ardmore &amp; Beechwood, before they signed with James. McCartney acquired their publishing rights from Ardmore<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006192–193_478-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry2006192–193-478">[467]</a></sup> in 1978,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-479"><a href="#cite_note-479">[468]</a></sup> and they are the only two Beatles songs owned by McCartney's company MPL Communications.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHarry2002536_480-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHarry2002536-480">[469]</a></sup> On 18 January 2017, McCartney filed a suit in the <a href="/wiki/United_States_district_court" title="United States district court">United States district court</a> against Sony/ATV Music Publishing seeking to reclaim ownership of his share of the Lennon–McCartney song catalogue beginning in 2018. Under US copyright law, for works published before 1978 the author can reclaim copyrights assigned to a publisher after 56 years.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-481"><a href="#cite_note-481">[470]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-482"><a href="#cite_note-482">[471]</a></sup> McCartney and Sony agreed to a confidential settlement in June 2017.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-483"><a href="#cite_note-483">[472]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-484"><a href="#cite_note-484">[473]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Selected_filmography">Selected filmography</span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-53"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-53">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Lennon said of Epstein, "We used to dress how we liked, on and off stage. He'd tell us that jeans were not particularly smart and could we possibly manage to wear proper trousers, but he didn't want us suddenly looking square. He'd let us have our own sense of individuality."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEThe_Beatles200067_40-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEThe_Beatles200067-40">[40]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-65">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"She Loves You" was surpassed in sales by "<a href="/wiki/Mull_of_Kintyre_(song)" title="Mull of Kintyre (song)">Mull of Kintyre</a>", by McCartney's post-Beatles band <a href="/wiki/Paul_McCartney_and_Wings" title="Paul McCartney and Wings">Wings</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a990_64-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a990-64">[63]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Vee-Jay company president <a href="/wiki/Ewart_Abner" title="Ewart Abner">Ewart Abner</a> resigned after it was disclosed he used company funds to cover gambling debts.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESpizer200436_87-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESpizer200436-87">[85]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-110"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-110">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">During the same week in April 1964, a third American Beatles LP joined the two already in circulation; two of the three reached the first spot on the <i>Billboard</i> <a href="/wiki/Billboard_200" title="Billboard 200">albums chart</a>, the third peaked at number two.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisohn1992351_109-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELewisohn1992351-109">[106]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-117"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-117">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Harrison's ringing 12-string inspired <a href="/wiki/Roger_McGuinn" title="Roger McGuinn">Roger McGuinn</a>, who obtained his own Rickenbacker and used it to craft the trademark sound of <a href="/wiki/The_Byrds" title="The Byrds">the Byrds</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGould2007286–287_116-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGould2007286–287-116">[112]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-120"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-120">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Starr was briefly hospitalised after a <a href="/wiki/Tonsillectomy" title="Tonsillectomy">tonsillectomy</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Jimmie_Nicol" title="Jimmie Nicol">Jimmie Nicol</a> sat in on drums for the first five dates.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisohn1992160–161,_163_119-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELewisohn1992160–161,_163-119">[114]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-172"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-172">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">It was not until <i><a href="/wiki/Sgt._Pepper%27s_Lonely_Hearts_Club_Band" title="Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band">Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band</a></i> in 1967 that a Beatles album was released with identical track listings in both the UK and the US.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200659_171-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESouthallPerry200659-171">[165]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-210"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-210">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Poirier identified what he termed its "mixed allusiveness": "It's unwise ever to assume that they're doing only one thing or expressing themselves in only one style ... one kind of feeling about a subject isn't enough ... any single induced feeling must often exist within the context of seemingly contradictory alternatives."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGould2007423–425_209-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGould2007423–425-209">[202]</a></sup> McCartney said at the time: "We write songs. We know what we mean by them. But in a week someone else says something about it, and you can't deny it. ... You put your own meaning at your own level to our songs."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGould2007423–425_209-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGould2007423–425-209">[202]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-229"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-229">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Epstein had been in a fragile emotional state, stressed by personal troubles. It was speculated that he was concerned that the band might not renew his management contract, due to expire in October, over discontent with his supervision of business matters, particularly regarding <a href="/wiki/Seltaeb" title="Seltaeb">Seltaeb</a>, the company that handled their US merchandising rights.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBrownGaines2002227–228_228-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBrownGaines2002227–228-228">[220]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-321"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-321">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The band unsuccessfully attempted to block the 1977 release of <i><a href="/wiki/Live!_at_the_Star-Club_in_Hamburg,_Germany;_1962" title="Live! at the Star-Club in Hamburg, Germany; 1962">Live! at the Star-Club in Hamburg, Germany; 1962</a></i>. The independently issued album compiled recordings made during the group's <a href="/wiki/The_Beatles_in_Hamburg" title="The Beatles in Hamburg">Hamburg residency</a>, taped on a basic recording machine using only one microphone.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a124–126_320-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHarry2000a124–126-320">[311]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-445"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-445">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Another estimate gives total international sales of over 1 billion units,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGould20079_347-2"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGould20079-347">[337]</a></sup> a figure based on EMI's statement and recognised by <i><a href="/wiki/Guinness_World_Records" title="Guinness World Records">Guinness World Records</a></i>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-444"><a href="#cite_note-444">[434]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-104"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-104">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFHamilton2013">Hamilton, Jack (18 November 2013). <a class="external text" href="http://www.slate.com/articles/arts/culturebox/2013/11/kennedy_s_assassination_the_beatles_and_phil_spector_nov_22_1963_was_a_bad.html" rel="nofollow">"Did JFK's Death Make Beatlemania Possible?"</a>. <i>Slate</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140925143800/http://www.slate.com/articles/arts/culturebox/2013/11/kennedy_s_assassination_the_beatles_and_phil_spector_nov_22_1963_was_a_bad.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 25 September 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-148"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-148">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20060910071729/https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/content_pages/record.asp?recordid=50867" rel="nofollow">"Most Recorded Song"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Guinness_World_Records" title="Guinness World Records">Guinness World Records</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-426"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-426">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFPowers2017"><a href="/wiki/Ann_Powers" title="Ann Powers">Powers, Ann</a> (24 July 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/538601651/a-new-canon-in-pop-music-women-belong-at-the-center-of-the-story" rel="nofollow">"A New Canon: In Pop Music, Women Belong at the Center of the Story"</a>. <a href="/wiki/NPR" title="NPR">NPR</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background: #b0c4de;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist 4em"><a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> singles <a href="/wiki/The_Beatles_discography#Singles" title="The Beatles discography">discography</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%;background: #EEEEEE;">UK and US<br/>(all labels)</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"></div><table class="nowraplinks vcard navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%;background: #EEEEEE;">1963</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li>"<a href="/wiki/Please_Please_Me_(song)" title="Please Please Me (song)">Please Please Me</a>" / "<a href="/wiki/Ask_Me_Why" title="Ask Me Why">Ask Me Why</a>"</li>
<li>"<a href="/wiki/From_Me_to_You" title="From Me to You">From Me to You</a>" / "<a href="/wiki/Thank_You_Girl" title="Thank You Girl">Thank You Girl</a>"</li>
<li>"<a href="/wiki/She_Loves_You" title="She Loves You">She Loves You</a>" / "<a href="/wiki/I%27ll_Get_You" title="I'll Get You">I'll Get You</a>"</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%;background: #EEEEEE;">1964</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li>"<a href="/wiki/Can%27t_Buy_Me_Love" title="Can't Buy Me Love">Can't Buy Me Love</a>" / "<a href="/wiki/You_Can%27t_Do_That" title="You Can't Do That">You Can't Do That</a>"</li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Awards_for_the_Beatles" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#e8e8ff;"><div id="Awards_for_the_Beatles" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/List_of_awards_and_nominations_received_by_the_Beatles" title="List of awards and nominations received by the Beatles">Awards for the Beatles</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0;font-size:114%"><div style="padding:0px">
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Score" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background: #EEDD82"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Academy_Award_Best_Original_Score" title="Template:Academy Award Best Original Score"><abbr style="background: #EEDD82;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Academy_Award_Best_Original_Score" title="Template talk:Academy Award Best Original Score"><abbr style="background: #EEDD82;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Academy_Award_Best_Original_Score&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background: #EEDD82;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Score" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Score" title="Academy Award for Best Original Score">Academy Award for Best Original Score</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1930s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Louis_Silvers" title="Louis Silvers">Louis Silvers</a> (1934)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Max_Steiner" title="Max Steiner">Max Steiner</a> (1935)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Leo_F._Forbstein" title="Leo F. Forbstein">Leo F. Forbstein</a> (1936)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Charles_Previn" title="Charles Previn">Charles Previn</a> (1937)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Erich_Wolfgang_Korngold" title="Erich Wolfgang Korngold">Erich Wolfgang Korngold</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> (1938)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Herbert_Stothart" title="Herbert Stothart">Herbert Stothart</a> / <a href="/wiki/Richard_Hageman" title="Richard Hageman">Richard Hageman</a>, <a href="/wiki/W._Franke_Harling" title="W. Franke Harling">W. Franke Harling</a>, <a href="/wiki/John_Leipold" title="John Leipold">John Leipold</a> and <a href="/wiki/Leo_Shuken" title="Leo Shuken">Leo Shuken</a> (1939)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1940s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Leigh_Harline" title="Leigh Harline">Leigh Harline</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paul_Smith_(composer)" title="Paul Smith (composer)">Paul J. Smith</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ned_Washington" title="Ned Washington">Ned Washington</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> (1940)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bernard_Herrmann" title="Bernard Herrmann">Bernard Herrmann</a> / <a href="/wiki/Frank_Churchill" title="Frank Churchill">Frank Churchill</a> and <a href="/wiki/Oliver_Wallace" title="Oliver Wallace">Oliver Wallace</a> (1941)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Max_Steiner" title="Max Steiner">Max Steiner</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ray_Heindorf" title="Ray Heindorf">Ray Heindorf</a> and <a href="/wiki/Heinz_Roemheld" title="Heinz Roemheld">Heinz Roemheld</a> (1942)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ray_Heindorf" title="Ray Heindorf">Ray Heindorf</a> (1943)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Max_Steiner" title="Max Steiner">Max Steiner</a> / <a href="/wiki/Morris_Stoloff" title="Morris Stoloff">Morris Stoloff</a> and <a href="/wiki/Carmen_Dragon" title="Carmen Dragon">Carmen Dragon</a> (1944)</li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Miklos_Rozsa" title="Miklos Rozsa">Miklos Rozsa</a> / <a href="/wiki/Georgie_Stoll" title="Georgie Stoll">Georgie Stoll</a> (1945)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hugo_Friedhofer" title="Hugo Friedhofer">Hugo Friedhofer</a> / <a href="/wiki/Morris_Stoloff" title="Morris Stoloff">Morris Stoloff</a> (1946)</li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Miklos_Rozsa" title="Miklos Rozsa">Miklos Rozsa</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> (1947)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Brian_Easdale" title="Brian Easdale">Brian Easdale</a> / <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Green" title="Johnny Green">Johnny Green</a> and <a href="/wiki/Roger_Edens" title="Roger Edens">Roger Edens</a> (1948)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Aaron_Copland" title="Aaron Copland">Aaron Copland</a> / <a href="/wiki/Roger_Edens" title="Roger Edens">Roger Edens</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lennie_Hayton" title="Lennie Hayton">Lennie Hayton</a> (1949)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1950s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Franz_Waxman" title="Franz Waxman">Franz Waxman</a> / <a href="/wiki/Adolph_Deutsch" title="Adolph Deutsch">Adolph Deutsch</a> and <a href="/wiki/Roger_Edens" title="Roger Edens">Roger Edens</a> (1950)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Franz_Waxman" title="Franz Waxman">Franz Waxman</a> / <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Green" title="Johnny Green">Johnny Green</a> and <a href="/wiki/Saul_Chaplin" title="Saul Chaplin">Saul Chaplin</a> (1951)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dimitri_Tiomkin" title="Dimitri Tiomkin">Dimitri Tiomkin</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> (1952)</li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bronislau_Kaper" title="Bronislau Kaper">Bronislau Kaper</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> (1953)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dimitri_Tiomkin" title="Dimitri Tiomkin">Dimitri Tiomkin</a> / <a href="/wiki/Adolph_Deutsch" title="Adolph Deutsch">Adolph Deutsch</a> and <a href="/wiki/Saul_Chaplin" title="Saul Chaplin">Saul Chaplin</a> (1954)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> / <a href="/wiki/Robert_Russell_Bennett" title="Robert Russell Bennett">Robert Russell Bennett</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jay_Blackton" title="Jay Blackton">Jay Blackton</a> and <a href="/wiki/Adolph_Deutsch" title="Adolph Deutsch">Adolph Deutsch</a> (1955)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Victor_Young" title="Victor Young">Victor Young</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ken_Darby" title="Ken Darby">Ken Darby</a> (1956)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Malcolm_Arnold" title="Malcolm Arnold">Malcolm Arnold</a> (1957)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dimitri_Tiomkin" title="Dimitri Tiomkin">Dimitri Tiomkin</a> / <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Andre_Previn" title="Andre Previn">Andre Previn</a> (1958)</li>
<li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Miklos_Rozsa" title="Miklos Rozsa">Miklos Rozsa</a> / <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Andre_Previn" title="Andre Previn">Andre Previn</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ken_Darby" title="Ken Darby">Ken Darby</a> (1959)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1960s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Ernest_Gold_(composer)" title="Ernest Gold (composer)">Ernest Gold</a> / <a href="/wiki/Morris_Stoloff" title="Morris Stoloff">Morris Stoloff</a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Sukman" title="Harry Sukman">Harry Sukman</a> (1960)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Henry_Mancini" title="Henry Mancini">Henry Mancini</a> / <a href="/wiki/Saul_Chaplin" title="Saul Chaplin">Saul Chaplin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Green" title="Johnny Green">Johnny Green</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sid_Ramin" title="Sid Ramin">Sid Ramin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Irwin_Kostal" title="Irwin Kostal">Irwin Kostal</a> (1961)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Maurice_Jarre" title="Maurice Jarre">Maurice Jarre</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ray_Heindorf" title="Ray Heindorf">Ray Heindorf</a> (1962)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Addison" title="John Addison">John Addison</a> / <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Andre_Previn" title="Andre Previn">Andre Previn</a> (1963)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Richard_M._Sherman" title="Richard M. Sherman">Richard M. Sherman</a> and <a href="/wiki/Robert_B._Sherman" title="Robert B. Sherman">Robert B. Sherman</a> / <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Andre_Previn" title="Andre Previn">Andre Previn</a> (1964)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Maurice_Jarre" title="Maurice Jarre">Maurice Jarre</a> / <a href="/wiki/Irwin_Kostal" title="Irwin Kostal">Irwin Kostal</a> (1965)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Barry_(composer)" title="John Barry (composer)">John Barry</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ken_Thorne" title="Ken Thorne">Ken Thorne</a> (1966)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Elmer_Bernstein" title="Elmer Bernstein">Elmer Bernstein</a> / <a href="/wiki/Alfred_Newman" title="Alfred Newman">Alfred Newman</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ken_Darby" title="Ken Darby">Ken Darby</a> (1967)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Barry_(composer)" title="John Barry (composer)">John Barry</a> / <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Green" title="Johnny Green">Johnny Green</a> (1968)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Burt_Bacharach" title="Burt Bacharach">Burt Bacharach</a> / <a href="/wiki/Lennie_Hayton" title="Lennie Hayton">Lennie Hayton</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Newman" title="Lionel Newman">Lionel Newman</a> (1969)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1970s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Francis_Lai" title="Francis Lai">Francis Lai</a> / <a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a>, <a href="/wiki/George_Harrison" title="George Harrison">George Harrison</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ringo_Starr" title="Ringo Starr">Ringo Starr</a>)</small> (1970)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Michel_Legrand" title="Michel Legrand">Michel Legrand</a> / <a href="/wiki/John_Williams" title="John Williams">John Williams</a> (1971)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Charlie_Chaplin" title="Charlie Chaplin">Charlie Chaplin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Raymond_Rasch" title="Raymond Rasch">Raymond Rasch</a> and <a href="/wiki/Larry_Russell" title="Larry Russell">Larry Russell</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Burns" title="Ralph Burns">Ralph Burns</a> (1972)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Marvin_Hamlisch" title="Marvin Hamlisch">Marvin Hamlisch</a> / <a href="/wiki/Marvin_Hamlisch" title="Marvin Hamlisch">Marvin Hamlisch</a> (1973)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Nino_Rota" title="Nino Rota">Nino Rota</a> and <a href="/wiki/Carmine_Coppola" title="Carmine Coppola">Carmine Coppola</a> / <a href="/wiki/Nelson_Riddle" title="Nelson Riddle">Nelson Riddle</a> (1974)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Williams" title="John Williams">John Williams</a> / <a href="/wiki/Leonard_Rosenman" title="Leonard Rosenman">Leonard Rosenman</a> (1975)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Jerry_Goldsmith" title="Jerry Goldsmith">Jerry Goldsmith</a> / <a href="/wiki/Leonard_Rosenman" title="Leonard Rosenman">Leonard Rosenman</a> (1976)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Williams" title="John Williams">John Williams</a> / <a href="/wiki/Jonathan_Tunick" title="Jonathan Tunick">Jonathan Tunick</a> (1977)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Giorgio_Moroder" title="Giorgio Moroder">Giorgio Moroder</a> / <a href="/wiki/Joe_Renzetti" title="Joe Renzetti">Joe Renzetti</a> (1978)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Georges_Delerue" title="Georges Delerue">Georges Delerue</a> / <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Burns" title="Ralph Burns">Ralph Burns</a> (1979)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1980s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Michael_Gore" title="Michael Gore">Michael Gore</a> (1980)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Vangelis" title="Vangelis">Vangelis</a> (1981)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Williams" title="John Williams">John Williams</a> / <a href="/wiki/Henry_Mancini" title="Henry Mancini">Henry Mancini</a> and <a href="/wiki/Leslie_Bricusse" title="Leslie Bricusse">Leslie Bricusse</a> (1982)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bill_Conti" title="Bill Conti">Bill Conti</a> / <a href="/wiki/Michel_Legrand" title="Michel Legrand">Michel Legrand</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alan_and_Marilyn_Bergman" title="Alan and Marilyn Bergman">Alan and Marilyn Bergman</a> (1983)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Maurice_Jarre" title="Maurice Jarre">Maurice Jarre</a> / <a href="/wiki/Prince_(musician)" title="Prince (musician)">Prince</a> (1984)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Barry_(composer)" title="John Barry (composer)">John Barry</a> (1985)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Herbie_Hancock" title="Herbie Hancock">Herbie Hancock</a> (1986)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Ryuichi_Sakamoto" title="Ryuichi Sakamoto">Ryuichi Sakamoto</a>, <a href="/wiki/David_Byrne" title="David Byrne">David Byrne</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cong_Su" title="Cong Su">Cong Su</a> (1987)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dave_Grusin" title="Dave Grusin">Dave Grusin</a> (1988)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Alan_Menken" title="Alan Menken">Alan Menken</a> (1989)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">1990s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background: #EEDD82;width:1%">2000s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Brit_Award_for_British_Album_of_the_Year" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Brit_British_Album" title="Template:Brit British Album"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Brit_British_Album" title="Template talk:Brit British Album"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Brit_British_Album&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Brit_Award_for_British_Album_of_the_Year" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Brit_Award_for_British_Album_of_the_Year" title="Brit Award for British Album of the Year">Brit Award for British Album of the Year</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">1977–2000</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><i><a href="/wiki/Sgt._Pepper%27s_Lonely_Hearts_Club_Band" title="Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band">Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band</a></i> – <a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> (1977)</li>

<li><i><a href="/wiki/...Nothing_Like_the_Sun" title="...Nothing Like the Sun">...Nothing Like the Sun</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Sting_(musician)" title="Sting (musician)">Sting</a> (1988)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_First_of_a_Million_Kisses" title="The First of a Million Kisses">The First of a Million Kisses</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Fairground_Attraction" title="Fairground Attraction">Fairground Attraction</a> (1989)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Raw_%26_the_Cooked_(album)" title="The Raw &amp; the Cooked (album)">The Raw and the Cooked</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Fine_Young_Cannibals" title="Fine Young Cannibals">Fine Young Cannibals</a> (1990)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Listen_Without_Prejudice_Vol._1" title="Listen Without Prejudice Vol. 1">Listen Without Prejudice Vol. 1</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/George_Michael" title="George Michael">George Michael</a> (1991)</li>

<li><i><a href="/wiki/Connected_(Stereo_MC%27s_album)" title="Connected (Stereo MC's album)">Connected</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Stereo_MC%27s" title="Stereo MC's">Stereo MC's</a> (1994)</li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Brit_Award_for_British_Group" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Brit_British_Group" title="Template:Brit British Group"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Brit_British_Group" title="Template talk:Brit British Group"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Brit_British_Group&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Brit_Award_for_British_Group" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Brit_Award_for_British_Group" title="Brit Award for British Group">Brit Award for British Group</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> (1977)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Police" title="The Police">The Police</a> (1982)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dire_Straits" title="Dire Straits">Dire Straits</a> (1983)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Culture_Club" title="Culture Club">Culture Club</a> (1984)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wham!" title="Wham!">Wham!</a> (1985)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dire_Straits" title="Dire Straits">Dire Straits</a> (1986)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Five_Star" title="Five Star">Five Star</a> (1987)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Pet_Shop_Boys" title="Pet Shop Boys">Pet Shop Boys</a> (1988)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Erasure" title="Erasure">Erasure</a> (1989)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Fine_Young_Cannibals" title="Fine Young Cannibals">Fine Young Cannibals</a> (1990)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Cure" title="The Cure">The Cure</a> (1991)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_KLF" title="The KLF">The KLF</a> and <a href="/wiki/Simply_Red" title="Simply Red">Simply Red</a> (1992)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Simply_Red" title="Simply Red">Simply Red</a> (1993)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Stereo_MC%27s" title="Stereo MC's">Stereo MC's</a> (1994)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Blur_(band)" title="Blur (band)">Blur</a> (1995)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Oasis_(band)" title="Oasis (band)">Oasis</a> (1996)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Manic_Street_Preachers" title="Manic Street Preachers">Manic Street Preachers</a> (1997)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Verve" title="The Verve">The Verve</a> (1998)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Manic_Street_Preachers" title="Manic Street Preachers">Manic Street Preachers</a> (1999)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Travis_(band)" title="Travis (band)">Travis</a> (2000)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Coldplay" title="Coldplay">Coldplay</a> (2001)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Travis_(band)" title="Travis (band)">Travis</a> (2002)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Coldplay" title="Coldplay">Coldplay</a> (2003)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Darkness_(band)" title="The Darkness (band)">The Darkness</a> (2004)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Franz_Ferdinand_(band)" title="Franz Ferdinand (band)">Franz Ferdinand</a> (2005)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kaiser_Chiefs" title="Kaiser Chiefs">Kaiser Chiefs</a> (2006)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Arctic_Monkeys" title="Arctic Monkeys">Arctic Monkeys</a> (2007)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Arctic_Monkeys" title="Arctic Monkeys">Arctic Monkeys</a> (2008)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Elbow_(band)" title="Elbow (band)">Elbow</a> (2009)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Kasabian" title="Kasabian">Kasabian</a> (2010)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Take_That" title="Take That">Take That</a> (2011)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Coldplay" title="Coldplay">Coldplay</a> (2012)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Mumford_%26_Sons" title="Mumford &amp; Sons">Mumford &amp; Sons</a> (2013)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Arctic_Monkeys" title="Arctic Monkeys">Arctic Monkeys</a> (2014)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Royal_Blood_(band)" title="Royal Blood (band)">Royal Blood</a> (2015)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Coldplay" title="Coldplay">Coldplay</a> (2016)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_1975" title="The 1975">The 1975</a> (2017)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Gorillaz" title="Gorillaz">Gorillaz</a> (2018)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_1975" title="The 1975">The 1975</a> (2019)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Foals_(band)" title="Foals (band)">Foals</a> (2020)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Little_Mix" title="Little Mix">Little Mix</a> (2021)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Wolf_Alice" title="Wolf Alice">Wolf Alice</a> (2022)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#cedff2;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year" title="Template:Grammy Award for Album of the Year"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year" title="Template talk:Grammy Award for Album of the Year"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year" title="Grammy Award for Album of the Year">Grammy Award for Album of the Year</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1959–1979</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="/wiki/The_Music_from_Peter_Gunn" title="The Music from Peter Gunn">The Music from Peter Gunn</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Henry_Mancini" title="Henry Mancini">Henry Mancini</a> (1959)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="/wiki/The_First_Family_(album)" title="The First Family (album)">The First Family</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Vaughn_Meader" title="Vaughn Meader">Vaughn Meader</a> (1963)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="/wiki/Getz/Gilberto" title="Getz/Gilberto">Getz/Gilberto</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Stan_Getz" title="Stan Getz">Stan Getz</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Gilberto" title="João Gilberto">João Gilberto</a> (1965)</span></li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#cedff2;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist" title="Template:Grammy Award for Best New Artist"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist" title="Template talk:Grammy Award for Best New Artist"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_New_Artist" title="Grammy Award for Best New Artist">Grammy Award for Best New Artist</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1960s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li>No Award (1959)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bobby_Darin" title="Bobby Darin">Bobby Darin</a> (1960)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bob_Newhart" title="Bob Newhart">Bob Newhart</a> (1961)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Peter_Nero" title="Peter Nero">Peter Nero</a> (1962)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Robert_Goulet" title="Robert Goulet">Robert Goulet</a> (1963)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Swingle_Singers" title="The Swingle Singers">The Swingle Singers</a> (1964)</li>
<li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> (1965)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Tom_Jones_(singer)" title="Tom Jones (singer)">Tom Jones</a> (1966)</li>
<li>No Award (1967)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bobbie_Gentry" title="Bobbie Gentry">Bobbie Gentry</a> (1968)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Feliciano" title="José Feliciano">José Feliciano</a> (1969)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1970s</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Crosby,_Stills,_Nash_%26_Young" title="Crosby, Stills, Nash &amp; Young">Crosby, Stills &amp; Nash</a> (1970)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Carpenters" title="The Carpenters">The Carpenters</a> (1971)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Carly_Simon" title="Carly Simon">Carly Simon</a> (1972)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/America_(band)" title="America (band)">America</a> (1973)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Bette_Midler" title="Bette Midler">Bette Midler</a> (1974)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Marvin_Hamlisch" title="Marvin Hamlisch">Marvin Hamlisch</a> (1975)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Natalie_Cole" title="Natalie Cole">Natalie Cole</a> (1976)</li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#cedff2;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media" title="Template:Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media" title="Template talk:Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_Score_Soundtrack_for_Visual_Media" title="Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media">Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1959−1980</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><i><a href="/wiki/Anatomy_of_a_Murder" title="Anatomy of a Murder">Anatomy of a Murder</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Duke_Ellington" title="Duke Ellington">Duke Ellington</a> (1959)</li>
<li>No Award (1960)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Exodus_(soundtrack)" title="Exodus (soundtrack)">Exodus</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Ernest_Gold_(composer)" title="Ernest Gold (composer)">Ernest Gold</a> (1961)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Breakfast_at_Tiffany%27s:_Music_from_the_Motion_Picture" title="Breakfast at Tiffany's: Music from the Motion Picture">Breakfast at Tiffany's</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Henry_Mancini" title="Henry Mancini">Henry Mancini</a> (1962)</li>
<li>No Award (1963)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Tom_Jones_(1963_film)" title="Tom Jones (1963 film)">Tom Jones</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/John_Addison" title="John Addison">John Addison</a> (1964)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Mary_Poppins:_Original_Cast_Soundtrack" title="Mary Poppins: Original Cast Soundtrack">Mary Poppins: Original Cast Soundtrack</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Richard_M._Sherman" title="Richard M. Sherman">Richard M. Sherman</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Robert_B._Sherman" title="Robert B. Sherman">Robert B. Sherman</a> (1965)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Sandpiper" title="The Sandpiper">The Sandpiper</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Mandel" title="Johnny Mandel">Johnny Mandel</a> (1966)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Doctor_Zhivago_(film)" title="Doctor Zhivago (film)">Doctor Zhivago</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Maurice_Jarre" title="Maurice Jarre">Maurice Jarre</a> (1967)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Music_from_Mission:_Impossible" title="Music from Mission: Impossible">Music from Mission: Impossible</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Lalo_Schifrin" title="Lalo Schifrin">Lalo Schifrin</a> (1968)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Graduate_(soundtrack)" title="The Graduate (soundtrack)">The Graduate</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Dave_Grusin" title="Dave Grusin">Dave Grusin</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Paul_Simon" title="Paul Simon">Paul Simon</a> (1969)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Butch_Cassidy_and_the_Sundance_Kid" title="Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid">Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Burt_Bacharach" title="Burt Bacharach">Burt Bacharach</a> (1970)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Let_It_Be_(1970_film)" title="Let It Be (1970 film)">Let It Be</a></i> – <a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> (<a href="/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a>, <a href="/wiki/George_Harrison" title="George Harrison">George Harrison</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Ringo_Starr" title="Ringo Starr">Ringo Starr</a>) (1971)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Shaft_(Isaac_Hayes_album)" title="Shaft (Isaac Hayes album)">Shaft</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Isaac_Hayes" title="Isaac Hayes">Isaac Hayes</a> (1972)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Godfather_(soundtrack)" title="The Godfather (soundtrack)">The Godfather</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Nino_Rota" title="Nino Rota">Nino Rota</a> (1973)</li>
<li><i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jonathan_Livingston_Seagull_(album)" title="Jonathan Livingston Seagull (album)">Jonathan Livingston Seagull</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Neil_Diamond" title="Neil Diamond">Neil Diamond</a> (1974)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/The_Way_We_Were:_Original_Soundtrack_Recording" title="The Way We Were: Original Soundtrack Recording">The Way We Were: Original Soundtrack Recording</a></i> – <a href="/wiki/Alan_and_Marilyn_Bergman" title="Alan and Marilyn Bergman">Alan and Marilyn Bergman</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Marvin_Hamlisch" title="Marvin Hamlisch">Marvin Hamlisch</a> (1975)</li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1981−2000</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<ul><li>1963

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background:#cedff2;;width:1%">1991–2000</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<li>1997
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Bobby_Bland" title="Bobby Bland">Bobby "Blue" Bland</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/The_Everly_Brothers" title="The Everly Brothers">The Everly Brothers</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Judy_Garland" title="Judy Garland">Judy Garland</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/St%C3%A9phane_Grappelli" title="Stéphane Grappelli">Stéphane Grappelli</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Buddy_Holly" title="Buddy Holly">Buddy Holly</a></li>

<li>1998

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style="background:#cedff2;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award" title="Template:Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award" title="Template talk:Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award&amp;action=edit"><abbr style="background:#cedff2;;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Jackson_Video_Vanguard_Award" title="Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award">Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><span class="nowrap"><a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a> and <a href="/wiki/Richard_Lester" title="Richard Lester">Richard Lester</a> (1984)</span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a> (1984)</span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/David_Byrne" title="David Byrne">David Byrne</a> (1985)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Zbigniew_Rybczy%C5%84ski" title="Zbigniew Rybczyński">Zbigniew Rybczyński</a> (1986)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/George_Michael" title="George Michael">George Michael</a> (1989)</span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Janet_Jackson" title="Janet Jackson">Janet Jackson</a> (1990)</span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Bon_Jovi" title="Bon Jovi">Bon Jovi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Wayne_Isham" title="Wayne Isham">Wayne Isham</a> (1991)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a> (1994)</span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Tom_Petty" title="Tom Petty">Tom Petty</a> (1994)</span></li>

<li><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/Nicki_Minaj" title="Nicki Minaj">Nicki Minaj</a> (2022)</span></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame_–_Class_of_1988" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:1988_Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Template:1988 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:1988_Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Template talk:1988 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:1988_Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame_–_Class_of_1988" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame" title="Rock and Roll Hall of Fame">Rock and Roll Hall of Fame</a> – <a href="/wiki/List_of_Rock_and_Roll_Hall_of_Fame_inductees" title="List of Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees">Class of 1988</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Performers</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/The_Beach_Boys" title="The Beach Boys">The Beach Boys</a></b>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Al_Jardine" title="Al Jardine">Al Jardine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mike_Love" title="Mike Love">Mike Love</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brian_Wilson" title="Brian Wilson">Brian Wilson</a>, <a href="/wiki/Carl_Wilson" title="Carl Wilson">Carl Wilson</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dennis_Wilson" title="Dennis Wilson">Dennis Wilson</a></li></ul></li>
<li><b><a class="mw-selflink selflink">The Beatles</a></b>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/George_Harrison" title="George Harrison">George Harrison</a>, <a href="/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ringo_Starr" title="Ringo Starr">Ringo Starr</a></li></ul></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/The_Drifters" title="The Drifters">The Drifters</a></b>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Ben_E._King" title="Ben E. King">Ben E. King</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rudy_Lewis" title="Rudy Lewis">Rudy Lewis</a>, <a href="/wiki/Clyde_McPhatter" title="Clyde McPhatter">Clyde McPhatter</a>, <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Moore_(singer)" title="Johnny Moore (singer)">Johnny Moore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bill_Pinkney" title="Bill Pinkney">Bill Pinkney</a>, <a href="/wiki/Charlie_Thomas_(musician)" title="Charlie Thomas (musician)">Charlie Thomas</a>, <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Gerhart_Thrasher&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Gerhart Thrasher (page does not exist)">Gerhart Thrasher</a></li></ul></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Bob_Dylan" title="Bob Dylan">Bob Dylan</a></b></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/The_Supremes" title="The Supremes">The Supremes</a></b>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Florence_Ballard" title="Florence Ballard">Florence Ballard</a>, <a href="/wiki/Diana_Ross" title="Diana Ross">Diana Ross</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mary_Wilson_(singer)" title="Mary Wilson (singer)">Mary Wilson</a></li></ul></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Early influences</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<li><b><a href="/wiki/Les_Paul" title="Les Paul">Les Paul</a></b></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Non-performers<br/>(Ahmet Ertegun Award)</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Berry_Gordy" title="Berry Gordy">Berry Gordy</a></b></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
